column2: CITATION report that 5% of the sentence pairs in an aligned parallel ChineseEnglish corpus contained inside-out alignments

column3: such as the one in Example 1.3
column4: cannot be induced by any of these theories; in fact
column5: there seems to be no useful synchronous grammar formalisms available that handle inside-out alignments
column6: with the possible exceptions of synchronous tree-adjoining grammars CITATION
column7: CITATION and generalized multitext grammars CITATION
column8: which are all way more complex than ITG
